verses.verse: (Restoration of Judah and Israel) (Isa 30.23; Jer 10.13; 14.22) Ask rain from the LORD in the season of the spring rain, from the LORD who makes the storm clouds, who gives showers of rain to you, (Heb them) the vegetation in the field to everyone.

(Job 13.4; Jer 27.9; Ezek 21.21; 34.5; Hos 3.4) For the teraphim (Or household gods) utter nonsense, and the diviners see lies; the dreamers tell false dreams and give empty consolation. Therefore the people (Heb they) wander like sheep; they suffer for lack of a shepherd.

(Jer 25.34-36; Ezek 34.12, 17) My anger is hot against the shepherds, and I will punish the leaders, (Or male goats) for the LORD of hosts cares for his flock, the house of Judah, and will make them like his proud war horse.
(Zech 9.10) Out of them shall come the cornerstone, out of them the tent peg, out of them the battle bow, out of them every commander.

(2 Sam 22.43; Hag 2.22) Together they shall be like warriors in battle, trampling the foe in the mud of the streets; they shall fight, for the LORD is with them, and they shall put to shame the riders on horses.

(v 12|ZEC 10:12; Zech 1.16; 8.8; 9.16; 13.9) I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph. I will bring them back because I have compassion on them, and they shall be as though I had not rejected them, for I am the LORD their God, and I will answer them.

(Isa 54.13; Zech 9.15; 13.9) Then the people of Ephraim shall become like warriors, and their hearts shall be glad as with wine. Their children shall see it and rejoice; their hearts shall exult in the LORD.
(Isa 5.26; Jer 33.22; Ezek 36.11) I will signal for them and gather them in, for I have redeemed them, and they shall be as numerous as they were before.
(Ezek 6.9) Though I scattered them among the nations, yet in far countries they shall remember me, and they shall rear their children and return.
(Isa 11.11; 49.19, 20; Jer 50.19) I will bring them home from the land of Egypt and gather them from Assyria; I will bring them to the land of Gilead and to Lebanon, until there is no room for them.

(Isa 19.5-7; 51.9, 10; Ezek 30.13; Zeph 2.13) They (Gk: Heb He) shall pass through the sea of distress, and the waves of the sea shall be struck down, and all the depths of the Nile dried up. The pride of Assyria shall be laid low, and the scepter of Egypt shall depart.
(Mic 4.5) I will make them strong in the LORD, and they shall walk in his name, says the LORD.
